00001 /*********************************************************************
00002 
00003 Author:     Stefan Ritt
00004 Date:       8/30/95, update 12/18/96 to use directIO driver
00005 Program:    giveio.c
00006 Compile:    cl -DWIN32 giveio.c
00007 
00008 Purpose:    Open an IO address space in the calling window
00009 
00010 *********************************************************************/
00011 
00012 #include <stdio.h>
00013 #include <windows.h>
00014 #include <math.h>
00015 #include <conio.h>
00016 
00017 
00018 /*********************************************************************
00019   Communication routines with directio device driver
00020 *********************************************************************/
00021 static HANDLE _hdio = 0;
00022 
00023 INT ss_directio_init()
00024 {
00025   _hdio = CreateFile("\\\\.\\directio", GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ, NULL,
00026                                        OPEN_EXISTING, 0, NULL);
00027   return (INT) _hdio;
00028 }
00029 
00030 INT ss_directio_exit()
00031 {
00032   return CloseHandle(_hdio);
00033 }
00034 
00035 INT ss_directio_give_port(INT start, INT end)
00036 {
00037 DWORD buffer[] = {6, start, end, 0};
00038 DWORD size;
00039 
00040   if (_hdio <= 0)
00041     return 0;
00042 
00043   if (DeviceIoControl(_hdio, (DWORD) 0x9c406000, &buffer, sizeof(buffer), 
00044                       NULL, 0, &size, NULL))
00045     return 1;
00046 
00047   return GetLastError();
00048 }
00049 
00050 INT ss_directio_lock_port(INT start, INT end)
00051 {
00052 DWORD buffer[] = {7, start, end, 0};
00053 DWORD size;
00054 
00055   if (_hdio <= 0)
00056     return 0;
00057 
00058   if (DeviceIoControl(_hdio, (DWORD) 0x9c406000, &buffer, sizeof(buffer), 
00059                       NULL, 0, &size, NULL))
00060     return 1;
00061 
00062   return GetLastError();
00063 }
00064 
00065 /*********************************************************************
00066   Main program. Request ports 0x42, 0x43 and 0x61 and play music
00067 *********************************************************************/
00068 
00069 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00070 {
00071 int i, p1, p2;
00072 
00073   if (argc != 3)
00074     {
00075     printf("usage: giveio <port1> <port2>\n");
00076     printf("  to open port1 to port2 (inclusive).\n");
00077     printf("  Ports are specified hexadecimally.\n");
00078     return 0;
00079     }
00080 
00081   sscanf(argv[1], "%x", &p1);
00082   sscanf(argv[2], "%x", &p2);
00083 
00084   if (p1 == 0 || p2 == 0)
00085     {
00086     printf("Ports may not be zero\n");
00087     return 0;
00088     }
00089 
00090   if (p1 == 0 || p2 == 0 || p1 > p2)
00091     {
00092     printf("Second port must be larger or equal to first port\n");
00093     return 0;
00094     }
00095 
00096   if (ss_directio_init() == 0)
00097     {
00098     printf("DirectIO driver not installed or started\n");
00099     return 0;
00100     }
00101 
00102   ss_directio_give_port(p1, p2);
00103   ss_directio_exit();
00104 
00105   printf("Ports 0x%x to 0x%x enabled sucessfully.\n", p1, p2);
00106 
00107         return 0;
00108 }
